tweets.text: NFM in action with #WILD #HealthyColn #Friendofthecoln @FWAGSouthWest volunteers to fix Bankside erosion and repair the footpath at Fairford. The deflectors are going to move silt bars, funding and expertise given by @EnvAgency @thameswater https://t.co/1fI6wo6rB1

Looking forward to chairing @LivingWithH2O Board today. Climate change is very real for us and we are fortunate to have a unique partnership approach delivering results @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE j https://t.co/LqEUsA6bDn

tweets.text:
Want to find out why #Salmon are leaping earlier than usual at the #RiverSevern weir in #Shrewsbury? 

Listen to @ChrisBaingerEA's interview ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/U0ErFC11B5 (1hr 10mins in). 

If you spot salmon in the river post your photos using #SpawningWatch so we can monitor them. https://t.co/lR8czeYE71

Monbiot: "Last year‚Äôs State of Nature report shows our wildlife populations continue to collapse. It's likely only to get worse. The govt is ripping up planning rules to permit a builders‚Äô free for all. Its new road-building programme will cover precious wild places in concrete"

3. I am not alone in feeling exasperated that the #farming industry and government have abjectly FAILED to address this issue, and yes, the condition of rivers has SUBSTANTIALLY worsened due to the increased density and housing of livestock and the use of land for #waste disposal

#slurry 1. In 1991 a report issued by the Nature Conservancy Council: Nature Conservation and Pollution of Farm Wastes highlighted the need for safe storage & disposal of farm wastes to reduce farm-based pollution.  @campaignstrat @theriverstrust @wwf_uk

Meanwhile in Herefordshire we await the actions of the Nutrient Management Board. So far it has failed to stop the destruction of the River Wye SAC SSSI.
It meets tomorrow but where and when is a mystery. We have the agenda but no board papers. @EnvAgency @WGEnviroAgri https://t.co/KAMp80UBrt

In the letter they state that in testing they had done, more than half of the samples breached hazardous waste thresholds, over 60% breached LOI threshold and 96% contained sulphate above limits suggesting gypsum being shredded into the ‚Äòfines‚Äô route.

Tune in at 2pm (BST) today to watch Help Callum
The new 360 experience from @UniofHull's @FloodSkinner @SeriousGeoGames and our partners at @LancasterUni and @EnvAgency https://t.co/8KDjIEXT3K
@AlanBarrierEA @EnvAgency Looking at the weather forecast it probably would have had to of been closed anyway. üôÇ

TODAY 2PM (BST) : Watch Help Callum, our new 360 experience.

https://t.co/IHC3th9cP9

#FloodAware #Flood #FloodResilience https://t.co/eilacfPVba

The #ThamesBarrier will be closing on Sunday 4th October for its annual full tide test closure.

It will start to close just after 09.00 and fully reopen around 19.00.

There will be no public event this year and our cafe will be closed. https://t.co/yo7uypeKaC

tweets.text: Such an out dated approach by @EnvAgency . Water sports are booming, wetsuit sales through the roof. We moved on from Victorian times... https://t.co/4mjVlOBwuB

Check this out at 2pm TODAY! This project with @EEIatHull @CUIDARProject @LancasterUni @SeriousGeoGames  & @EnvAgency has turned Callum's experience of flooding into a virtual experience for all. Please share! 

#research #floods #resilience #FloodAware https://t.co/zl3xFTXeoN

@JackPerksPhoto @Trent_R_Trust @TrentGateway @Nottswildlife @EnvAgencyMids @theriverstrust Interesting. Do they need to molt to do this..? I wonder if they do, do predatory fish like Bass capitalize on this.

We‚Äôve been on Willow Brook, #Leicester today, clearing out fly tipped rubbish. Fencing, mattresses, electrical goods & clothes among items dumped.  We‚Äôre following up with enquiries about where it all came from. Check if someone is registered to take waste https://t.co/hukWjjQ6VU https://t.co/wAo1PvDTui

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service ‚Äì your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

Just as the surf picks up and swells become more consistent every winter @EnvAgency turns off its pollution notification and pumps raw sewage into the sea without us knowing. Apparently no one surfs in the winter. Sort it out. https://t.co/fSEH2G0CB1
@CarveMag @EnvAgency Is this an EA choice, or has it been forced onto them by cuts?

We've been busy over the last month tackling Japanese knotweed. This invasive non-native plant outcompetes our native plant species.  We are working hard so our river is knotweed free!! #INNS #INNSOUT #riverholme @EnvAgency @YISF__INNS https://t.co/RjI4CJvKqg

The historic concrete culvert in a tributary of the Torridge represented a barrier to fish movement. The old quarry track was no longer used and the landowner agreed to the culverts removal, opening up >2km of watercourse upstream to fish @EnvAgency #WEG #TRRP https://t.co/8096LIr5kJ

@chrisw100 @EnvAgencyMids @Team4Nature @WillPegg1 @SolihullCouncil @EnvAgency @WKWT Riffles are shallow areas created by deposition of gravels and sediment. As the water rushes over these rocks and gravels it adds oxygen to the water Macroinvertebrates that need oxygenated water like stonefly & species of mayfly live in these areas  & are food for fish and birds https://t.co/du06Mu3kAA

We have recently installed new signs at Thorpeness which warn of potential hazards.

Our signs are there to keep you safe so please make sure you pay attention to them when you come across them. 

#Safety #Suffolk https://t.co/yMJEOjCw57
@SoliLandscape @EnvAgencyMids @Team4Nature @WillPegg1 @SolihullCouncil @EnvAgency @WKWT Fantastic. A great word doing great work.
